column5: Decided to go and check how the steelies are doing today....they were there....ready and willing to play....6/8 for the day....lot of natural fish which is good to see. Fish was hiding in the deep pools....largest about 8 Lbs....water and air were cold though....I guess it is to be expected in February....but not cold enough to get enough ice on Simcoe....those whities are getting fat for sure....May 15 can't come soon enough )  Few shots from the day....not easy to take pictures with cell phone when you are alone....                    Cheers,  Ice Fisherman
Some nice fish there, way to go !!!!
nice shootin!....it sure doesnt feel like it did last Febuary....
pretty good shot of those fish!
Very nice! I hope to get out for some chrome this weekend. What a winter, that's awesome
Man, the weather has be on the river guys side this year. Nice fish Emil.  I,ll be tying up some saks for this sunday.
Just curious how do you tell the natural fish from the stocked ones , are the stockers all tagged?
Depending on the body of water...some are tagged many are with clipped fins....the ones caught this time were all naturals with all fins present.  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Awsome to see a few with the weather how its been great fishing cond not many post going up but well done!
Some very very nice chrome bullets, Emil.  Good to see you still slayin' em.
I love ice fishing for whities and lakers but the steelhead more than fill the void! Nice pictures for any camera. Dan O.
